item.title: 5 Steps to Frictionless AI
item.description: It has been a decade since Harvard Business Review called Data Scientist the sexiest career in the 21st Century. The companies who grabbed onto these talents have not only transformed but completely disrupted the status quo in the data & analytics industry. Much of this hype was initially driven by big tech giants (FAANG, or MAANG circa Nov 2021), but there has been an explosion of high-performing AI teams popping out of every corner of the world.

item.title: What the Ops are you talking about?
item.description: The software industry has been obsessed with the various ops-terms since the popularisation of DevOps in the late 2000s. Ten years ago, software development to deployment has a throw-over-the-world approach. A software engineer develops the app, then throw it over to the operational engineers. The app breaks often during deployment and creates significant friction between the teams.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Here are some of my professional projects. Most of the time, my role is a data scientist. But I often also perform the role of machine learning engineer & data engineer.

item.title: Talks
item.description: As a Recovering Data Scientist & MLOps Evangelist, I love sharing my passion with audiences who are interested in the world of Data/ML/AI. Here are the topics I’m interested at speaking about:

item.title: Launching Into Uncertainty‚Ää-‚Ää6 Smart Steps to Future-Proof Your ML¬†Models
item.description: There have been many articles focusing on how machine learning can and is helping during the pandemic. South Korean and Taiwanese governments successfully demonstrated how they used AI to slow the spread of COVID-19. French tech company identifying hot spots where masks are not being worn, advising where governments can focus on education. Data and medical professionals collaborating to index medical journal papers on COVID-19.

item.title: With AI, You Either Go Big or Go Home
item.description: Most companies choose to start with building small scale PoCs or POVs. Unfortunately, with this approach, many struggled to move from experimentation to scale. According to Michael Gale at the recent Nvidia virtual GTC conference: starting small means staying small.

item.title: 3 Tips You Need To Save Your Data Science Project¬†Scope
item.description: As a data scientist, you expect to get a job that lets you do cool stuff‚Ää-‚ÄäBig data, Big machine (or cloud, like the grown-ups), and Deep neural networks. Reality quickly creeps in as you realize the mismatch between your model, your project manager’s timeline, and your stakeholder’s expectation.

item.title: Quotes

item.title: O'Reilly: What you need to know about Product Management for AI
item.description: Product managers have a tremendously tough job. An AI product managers does everything a traditional PM does, and much more .

item.title: Rise above the ordinary ‚Äî a data science reading list
item.description: As one of the fastest-growing industries, being a data scientist without a research group can be incapacitating. At the end of last year, I realized I am often missing out on new development in the industry, unknowingly reinventing the wheel, and falling short in conversations with experts. Being a data science consultant, my stress-level exploded as I constantly felt under-prepared going into client meetings.

item.title: Considerations for Deploying an ML Model
item.description:
‚úà Deploying a machine learning model is like flying an airplane üõ©

Having no logging is like flying without a Blackbox. Any terrorist can hijack the plane without any consequences.

item.title: McKinsey: Global AI Survey
item.description: This study from McKinsey suggested that there have been measurable benefits from deployed AI. It is encouraging to see that AI adoption across all industries and regions are growing, especially that the majority of the executives reported that it has increased their revenue and/or reduced cost.

item.title: 3 Tips on Defining a Data Science Project Scope with Business
item.description: As a data scientist, you expect to get a job that lets you do cool stuff ‚Äî Big data, Big machine (or cloud, like the grown-ups) and Deep neural networks. Reality quickly creeps in as you realise the mismatch between your model, your project manager‚Äôs timeline and your stakeholder‚Äôs expectation. What they needed (often) is not a 128-layer ResNet, but a simple select & group by query that delivers actionable insights.

item.title: 5 Reasons Why You Should Join Deep Learning Indaba 2019
item.description: In April this year, instead of organising my 20-something birthday party, I spent hours writing motivating emails to my company to convince them to send me to Deep Learning Indaba.
